intro: Serpocaulon psychotrium, commonly known as the ghost plant, is a unique species of liverwort that exhibits a distinctive, ethereal appearance. It is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that resemble ghostly shapes, giving it its common name. This plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments, often growing on decaying wood or in rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, contributing to its elusive nature. Despite its simple morphology, Serpocaulon psychotrium plays a role in ecological systems by contributing to nutrient cycling in its habitat.
